intro: Melampyrum laxum var. aristatum, commonly known as the erect yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on host plants for water and nutrients while performing photosynthesis. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in erect spikes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators in its native range.
